content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    # Lowercase the column name
    cleaned_col = lowercase(col)

    # Strip any leading or trailing whitespaces
    cleaned_col = strip(cleaned_col)

    # Replace any spaces and hyphens with an underscore
    cleaned_col = replace(cleaned_col, r"[\s-]" => "_")

    return cleaned_col
end

# Test the function
println(clean_column("My Column"))     # Outputs: my_column
println(clean_column("Another-Column")) # Outputs: another_column
println(clean_column("  Final Column  ")) # Outputs: final_column
```

This function first calls the `lowercase` function to convert the column name to lowercase. Then it calls the `strip` function to remove any leading or trailing spaces. Finally, it uses the `replace` function to replace any spaces or hyphens with an underscore. The regular expression `r"[\s-]"` is used to match any whitespace character (space, tab, newline) or a hyphen.
